unnormalised: ## Lights, Camera, Festival! Why Film Festivals Should Be on Your Radar
normalised: ## Lights, Camera, Festival! Why Film Festivals Should Be on Your Radar

unnormalised: Hey everyone! Are you a movie buff? Do you spend weekends binge-watching the latest on Netflix, Amazon Prime, or Hotstar? Then you might be missing out on a whole world of cinematic experiences: Film Festivals!
normalised: Hey everyone! Are you a movie buff? Do you spend weekends binge watching the latest on N E T F L I X, Amazon Prime, or Hotstar? Then you might be missing out on a whole world of cinematic experiences: Film Festivals!

unnormalised: Forget the big-budget Bollywood blockbusters for a minute (though I love a good SRK film as much as the next person!). Film festivals offer a glimpse into the independent, the experimental, and the truly unique stories being told across the globe. Think of it as a curated collection of hidden gems you won't find anywhere else.

unnormalised: Imagine watching a documentary about a remote village in Rajasthan, followed by a quirky indie comedy from Kerala, and then engaging in a Q&A with the director. That's the magic of film festivals!
normalised: Imagine watching a documentary about a remote village in Rajasthan, followed by a quirky indie comedy from Kerala, and then engaging in a Q and A with the director. That's the magic of film festivals!

unnormalised: India itself has a vibrant film festival scene. The International Film Festival of India (IFFI) in Goa is a major one, drawing crowds from all over. Plus, there are countless smaller, regional festivals celebrating specific genres, languages, or themes. The Dharamshala International Film Festival, for example, is known for its breathtaking location and focus on independent cinema. There's even the Kolkata International Film Festival which focuses on world cinema with a special emphasis on Asian films.

unnormalised: Why should you attend? Well, for starters, you get to see films you wouldn't normally have access to. Secondly, it's a fantastic opportunity to network with filmmakers, actors, and other industry professionals. Who knows, you might even land your dream job! It's also a great cultural experience, broadening your perspectives and exposing you to different viewpoints.

unnormalised: And don't worry about the ticket prices. Many festivals offer student discounts and affordable passes. Plus, the experience is priceless! Think of it as an investment in your cinephile soul. Some festivals even have screenings in smaller towns, making them accessible to more people. Remember those smaller screenings in Meerut last year? They were a hit!

unnormalised: So, ditch the usual Friday night Bollywood routine and check out what film festivals are happening near you. You might just discover your next favorite film... and a whole new world of cinema. Maybe you can even find that gem that reminds you of Guru Dutt’s *Pyaasa* in its raw emotion and storytelling. Trust me, you won't regret it!
